title: Structure of Hypergeometric Notation
text: Note that the notation for a Hypergeometric distribution is X ~ H(r, $$b$$, n) that reads as "X is a random variable with a hypergeometric distribution". The parameters are $$r$$, $$b$$, and $$n$$ where $$r$$ is the size of the group of interest (first group), $$b$$ is the size of the second group, and $$n$$ is the size of the chosen sample.

title: Determining the Size of the Group of Interest
text: What is the size of the group of interest? In other words, how many not technically proficient volunteers are there?

title: Determining the Size of the Second Group
text: What is the size of the second group? In other words, how many technically proficient volunteers are there?

title: Determining the Size of the Chosen Sample
text: What is the size of the sample? In other words, how many people will be chosen to be part of the technology task force committee?

title: Putting it All Together
text: Knowing that the size of the group of interest is $$8$$, the size of the second group is $$20$$, and the size of the chosen sample is $$10$$, plug this into the formula to determine the hypergeometric notation of this question.
